segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Sunset in Dol-Makjar. Two days ago, Thjazi Fang was executed. Yesterday, late into the night going into the wee hours of today, this morning, you bid farewell to a group of your allies, companions, friends, and family headed north after Casimir Gavendale and Cyd Pridesire. after Casimir Gavendale and Cyd Pridesire. And you said goodbye to some companions headed east with a newly reanimated Occtis Tachonis. The Stone of Nightsong vanishing into the east.
segments.summary: Opening narration establishing the timeline and recent events in Dol-Makjar

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: All of you head from various institutions to the Seven Stars in the Rookery. Azune, leaving the Brethren Hall, you look out. It's the end of the day. In addition to those that were dismissed, many resignations have piled up today. As you leave the Brethren Hall, you look and see a small open-walled tent you look and see a small open-walled tent at the edge of the marketplace right outside the Brethren Hall with a banner saying "The Sons of Dawn" on it. You see some small symbols of the Candescent Creed and some dismissed Revolutionary Guard being hailed by what looks to be a mercenary company signing people up for work.
segments.summary: Azune leaves Brethren Hall and observes a mercenary company recruiting dismissed guards

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Is this mercenary company familiar to me?
segments.summary: Azune asks if he recognizes the mercenary company

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Give me a history check.
segments.summary: DM calls for a history check

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Shit.
segments.summary: Azune reacts to the roll request

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Call it DC 12.
segments.summary: DM sets the difficulty

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Okay. Eight.
segments.summary: Azune rolls an 8

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You have not heard of them before, but you recognize the marks of the Candescent Creed.
segments.summary: DM explains Azune doesn't know the company but recognizes the religious symbols

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: I sure do.
segments.summary: Azune confirms he recognizes the Candescent Creed symbols

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Bolaire, deep in the bowels of the Archanade, where is the Blade of Shay Claw kept? The last of the Pariah Blades.
segments.summary: Scene transitions to Bolaire in the Archanade discussing the location of a legendary blade

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: Well, there are several of them, and we have them separated. They're not saved in the same place just in case we do get robbed. I go to the one that is easiest to get to, which is down in the archives, which are supposed to be off-limits to everybody, but enough money can get you into a lot of places. And it's stuck in what looks like-- if you know what an art filing cabinet is with these very thin metal drawers that pull out and they have labels on them and it is mislabeled.
segments.summary: Bolaire explains how the Pariah Blades are stored separately for security and leads to one in the archives

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: And I open it. And it is sitting, sat in a layer of very fine sand that has been pressed and molded so that it can only hold this, and there is no movement possible for this sword.
segments.summary: Bolaire describes the careful storage method for the blade

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: The Lady Cormoray looks at it. "May I touch it?"
segments.summary: Lady Cormoray asks permission to touch the blade

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: Of course.
segments.summary: Bolaire grants permission

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She does not go to lift the sword.
segments.summary: Lady Cormoray doesn't attempt to lift the sword

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: It would be hard to.
segments.summary: Bolaire notes the difficulty of lifting the sword

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She traces her finger along the blade across the fuller, gets to the point of the sword and pushes down on it until it pricks her finger.
segments.summary: Lady Cormoray deliberately pricks her finger on the sword's point

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: Are you all right? Do you need anything? Oh dear. I--
segments.summary: Bolaire expresses concern for Lady Cormoray's injury

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "No, no. I'm all right. A little bit of blood on the blade. I'm sorry." You see that she says, "I can clean it, if you'd like."
segments.summary: Lady Cormoray apologizes for getting blood on the blade and offers to clean it

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: Oh, I've got it. And I use-- I hold my face in a couple places and I use Prestidigitation to clean the blade before putting it away with great fanfare.
segments.summary: Bolaire uses magic to clean the blade and carefully stores it away

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Beg your pardon. Moment seized me. I simply thought how interesting it would be to add an injury to the story of this blade."
segments.summary: Lady Cormoray explains her motivation for pricking herself on the blade

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: It is something to touch history. It connects us. I understand the desire. I would be a little bit more careful. Some of this, some of these objects can become difficult. We actually, I'm sure you will notice, we can always, you can always, I would say, identify people who work here, the archivists, because they tend to have injuries related to their work. Rosadella, who is currently upstairs, lost both her hands in a mechanism that we did not know was a short Teleportation spell. Thankfully, we have these wonderful pieces that she gets to use called the Aether's Grasp Bracers, I believe we call them. So, she gets invisible hands.
segments.summary: Bolaire warns about dangerous artifacts and shares an anecdote about an injured archivist

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "How challenging would it be for the Lloy Wing to change halls with the Selodyne Wing?"
segments.summary: Lady Cormoray asks about relocating wing sections

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: Oh. (laughs) Oh, honestly, it might be cheaper to just build a new wing.
segments.summary: Bolaire suggests the relocation would be extremely expensive

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "(chuckles) That can be arranged." You see she says, "I'm sorry. My time here is at an end. But I would love anything in writing about the actual logistical hurdle of what it would mean to move the artifacts here to the current location of the Selodyne Wing."
segments.summary: Lady Cormoray indicates she has funding available and requests a written assessment

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: Would I have to be in contact with the people who run the Selodyne or would this be something I could handle myself?
segments.summary: Bolaire asks about coordination requirements for the assessment

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Collaboration would be greatly appreciated." And she turns to leave with Temoday Wurnst, leaving Bolaire to attend to his normal duties.
segments.summary: Lady Cormoray requests collaboration and departs with her companion

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: (exhales sharply)
segments.summary: Bolaire reacts to the departure

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Murray.
segments.summary: Scene transitions to Murray

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You are seated back in the office which no longer has a tiny little desk on top of a big one as Dean Kora looks at you. "Your politics are as plain as the gems in your mouth."
segments.summary: Murray meets with Dean Kora who comments on Murray's obvious political stance

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: So are yours.
segments.summary: Murray retorts to Dean Kora

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Murray, we want a little bit of continuity here at the Penteveral. It can't all get turned on its head overnight. If you continue to telegraph your disappointment, you will force my hand. What is it you need in order to do your job?"
segments.summary: Dean Kora warns Murray about her attitude and asks what she needs

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: (scoffs) No interference.
segments.summary: Murray demands autonomy in her work

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Can the same be expected in return?"
segments.summary: Dean Kora asks for mutual non-interference

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: You tell me. It seems like the Sundered Houses have quite the agenda coming in here.
segments.summary: Murray accuses the Sundered Houses of having ulterior motives

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Their agenda is not your job. Your job is to manage the equipment and the material needs of the various departments of this university."
segments.summary: Dean Kora defines Murray's job responsibilities

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: My job is to look after--
segments.summary: Murray begins to argue about her job description

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: (thumps) "I'll tell you what your job is! That's what just changed today, Murray. I'll tell you. Now, if that's a problem, I'm not afraid to make a big mess. You got a lot of friends here and none of them matter, so you tell me how we play it."
segments.summary: Dean Kora aggressively asserts authority and threatens Murray's position

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Yeah. I'll be good.
segments.summary: Murray submits to avoid confrontation

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "I'm glad to hear that. Ellipides had a long leash. He was a very sweet old halfling man. I know you. I'm like you-- even if you don't want to see it. I made my way here on my own, too. I'm not about to lose this opportunity."
segments.summary: Dean Kora compares herself to Murray and references the previous dean

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: I recommend that you keep that one of your five fingers out of my face next time, but understood and heard.
segments.summary: Murray makes a pointed comment about Dean Kora's gesture while agreeing

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Thank you, Murray. That'll be all."
segments.summary: Dean Kora dismisses Murray

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: As Murray walks to the door, she turns around. We have 10 fingers, by the way.
segments.summary: Murray corrects Dean Kora's finger count while leaving

segments.speaker: DM (Matt)
segments.content: The finale episode of "The Mighty Nein" airs next week. So you'll be able to officially binge all eight episodes of this first season, along with our final episode of "Inside the Mighty Nein," discussing everything in the back half of season one and featuring some very special guests. So check it out now on Prime Video. And thank you all so much for watching the show.
segments.summary: Matt announces The Mighty Nein finale and thanks viewers

segments.speaker: Laura Bailey
segments.content: If you're in need of a last minute gift, send Critmas magic to your loved ones with a digital Critical Role gift card, available at all our Critical Role online shops, starting at $25.
segments.summary: Laura advertises Critical Role gift cards

segments.speaker: Taliesin Jaffe
segments.content: And with that, "Dispatch" is out and fully available to play right now. You can also grab it at a discount in the Steam Winter Sale starting today, December 18th. Check it out now. You can fix her. It's date everyone. Check it out now at dispatchgame.com.
segments.summary: Taliesin promotes the Dispatch game

segments.speaker: Marisha Ray
segments.content: Friendly reminder that there will be no new episodes of Campaign 4 over the next couple of weeks as our team takes a well-deserved rest. Our team needs this rest during the Christmas and New Year's holiday season here in the United States. We hope you take this opportunity to catch up, rest, or play a game with loved ones. That's always good in the holidays. We have resources like recaps, "Previously On," which is our little video series and Critical Role Cooldowns to help you get up to speed or dive further into the story of Aramán. Find everything you need at critrole.com/campaign4 and we'll see you back in Aramán on January 15th.
segments.summary: Marisha announces holiday break for Campaign 4

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hello, and welcome back to another very exciting episode of Critical Role. I invite you now here to the depths of Castle Delawney.
segments.summary: Brennan welcomes viewers back and sets the scene at Castle Delawney

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Here in Gormalay in the Kingdom of Timmony. Our friends have been so successful up until this point. To remind us how we came to this dark and dismal place-- Let's retrace our steps to see what choices we made that might've brought us here.
segments.summary: Brennan sarcastically notes the party's success and begins recap
segments.location: Castle Delawney, Gormalay, Kingdom of Timmony

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: It all began with the death of our friend, Thjazi Fang. Betrayed, as he was, by Casimir Gavendale and for a moment, we feared, the young brother of Teor, Talcydimir Pridesire. However, we discovered that young Cyd was still true of faith and convicted in his heart with loyalty, seizing the deed to Castle Sloak from the Crow Keeper tavern and making his way north. You followed him-- away from the funeral of Thjazi Fang, Thimble's beloved longtime partner in crime, Kattigan and Teor's beloved friend and former member of the Torn Banner and the target of the Lord Wicander Halovar's family, him and his Aspirant, the demon Tyranny.
segments.summary: Brennan recaps Thjazi's death, Casimir's betrayal, and Cyd's loyalty

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Moving through the Dahapshanee Wood where you encountered the gnome Ulbid Morn and you encountered the fairies of Hawthorn's Glade. You made your way through the city of Arderin and up towards Sloak where you found that treacherous Casimir Gavendale and Thimble smote his ruin on the castle ramparts.
segments.summary: Brennan recaps the journey through Dahapshanee Wood and Thimble killing Casimir
segments.location: Dahapshanee Wood, Hawthorn's Glade, Arderin, Castle Sloak

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You then discovered that the Tachonis envoys that had come and literally spanked Casimir Gavendale with a longsword lacerating his buttocks, such that an enterprising doctor had reason to get him alone in a room.
segments.summary: Brennan recaps the Tachonis attacking Casimir

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You followed the Tachonis north believing that they had captured Cyd. With your vengeance taken on Casimir, it was the rescue of Cyd that loomed large in your mind's eye. What were the Tachonis doing in these lands? The regal-looking Lord Doset, his older sister, the skull-faced, tattooed Univere Tachonis, and their knight attendant of the vassal house of Seremai.
segments.summary: Brennan recaps following the Tachonis to rescue Cyd

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Well, in these treacherous circumstances, you were glad for the companionship of your allies, the Hounds of the King who you met that took you up the Miller's Road, the Dame Morgaine and Sir Hawkins, speaking hounds in service to King Augustus Valian of Timmony, Old King Gus. They took you up the Miller's Road, a secret way by which these hounds, capable not only of speech but of spellcasting, were able to find that gave you safe passage up through the lands to make your way to Tybry's Lea, the seat of the Earl of Gormalay.
segments.summary: Brennan recaps meeting the Hounds of the King and traveling the Miller's Road

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: On your way on the Miller's Road, you encountered the Black Rabbits, a group of outlaw fairies that gave you some news that apparently the House of Royce had fallen. Word had reached them through fae channels. It seems, indeed, as you have pursued, with some success, your aims that set you out on this path from Dol-Makjar, where your quest began, that indeed the brutal and at times savage world of Aramán turns even without your direct attention. Who knows what could have befallen the House of Royce?
segments.summary: Brennan recaps meeting the Black Rabbits and learning of House Royce's fall

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Arriving in Tybry's Lea in the bright sun, you saw a realm of some pastoral beauty and grandeur, the beginnings of Candle Feast. Indeed, you can see that the Candescent Creed, that beloved religion of Wick's family, was preparing cookies and candles and paper lanterns. Children wiping snot from their face to talk to Thimble about what was going on in the town. You found a young acolyte excitedly giving you news and a hospital working to help those affected by this bellows fever that seems to be spreading.
segments.summary: Brennan recaps arriving at Tybry's Lea during Candle Feast preparations

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: On your way discovering, you've also met Felltower, another Hound of the King here in this place. And you discovered that it seemed the Tachonis were working out of Castle Delawney directly. Witnessing a sudden conversion of none other than the Earl of Gormalay, a lord of an entire region of the Kingdom of Timmony to the Candescent Creed, walking amongst the people in mourning for his late lady wife, you used the distraction of this massive festival to get yourself into position.
segments.summary: Brennan recaps meeting Felltower and witnessing the Earl's conversion

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: And using a Chanter's Egg that you had taken from your old friend Ulbid, the gnomish astronomer, you invisibly made your way into the castle after Thimble very stealthily spied on the goings-on of the Tachonis, who seemed to be making a hasty retreat for reasons we cannot exactly say.
segments.summary: Brennan recaps using the Chanter's Egg to infiltrate the castle

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Wending your way into the smaller keep, you made your way downstairs where Kattigan spoke in the manner of a ranger to a rat who said that there were those of his kind that had gone into the dark of the dungeon and died without leaving a scent of rot. Whatever he meant, you could not say until perhaps it was too late as Tyranny, in disguise as Occtis Tachonis--
segments.summary: Brennan recaps descending into the dungeon and Kattigan speaking to rats

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Indeed. And you know what? Here's the thing, Whitney. He's not wrong. Rounding the corner, we discover what a rat means when it says that one can die without rotting, for indeed, life does seem to end when one is turned to stone. Rounding the corner, you see this knight of Seremai-- surrounded by guards of the House Tachonis with a basilisk on a chain, a monster of the world of Aramán, crystalline and stony spines arising from the bridge of its ugly snout and its arched back as its eyes gleam with white light. Tyranny.
segments.summary: Brennan reveals the basilisk encounter and Tyranny's true identity

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As you begin to turn to stone-- Your 15 constitution saving throw ends the effect. You're fine. Everyone roll initiative!
segments.summary: Brennan describes the petrification effect being resisted and calls for initiative

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: I've been shitting myself, Brennan!

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You got to leave people on a cliffhanger, folks. Okay? You got to leave them on a bit of a cliffhanger.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: All right, all right. This is how we turn it around. We turn it around right here! We turn it around.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Everybody, this is your moment, okay? Teor, what did we get?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Initiative rolls: Teor got a 12, Thimble got 24, Kattigan got 13, Tyranny got 12, Wick got 8. After tiebreaker rolls: Thimble (24), Kattigan (13), Tyranny (19), Teor (17), Wick (8).
segments.summary: Initiative order is determined for combat

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: A secret door opened here. In the rear, coming down the hallway, Kattigan, Wick, followed by Wulferic. Around the corner here Thimble. Both of you eye to eye around either side of that corner. Looking at this holding cell in the dungeon down here, you can smell in this place rot, blood, humanoid waste. This is not a jail where people that have been arrested legitimately are kept. You don't keep people in a jail behind a secret door that you intend to see justice. This is a place where people were disappeared to, left in waiting.
segments.summary: The party discovers a hidden dungeon with a foul-smelling holding cell

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You are first to act, I think, just as you hear a note of smug triumph in the voice of that vassal knight of the Tachonis and can tell immediately. 'You'd be dead already.' And that would be the first thing that Thimble has heard that Occtis' family has designs on him in that way.
segments.summary: Thimble overhears threats against Occtis from a Tachonis knight

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Can I fly up and get behind Tyranny? I want to Faerie Fire into that room, so that is within 60 feet a 20-foot cube. So I'm just going to, as I'm flying up quickly behind Tyranny, I'm going to stop really fast and all my pixie dust is going to fly forward. And it's going to light up everything.
segments.summary: Thimble casts Faerie Fire to illuminate enemies in the room

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: So we're going to roll dexterity saves for them. Dex 10. Unbelievably, basilisk with a minus one to dexterity gets an 18. Our knight makes it. The three guards in the front all become affected by Faerie Fire, casting light. You will have advantage on attacks against all of them.
segments.summary: Faerie Fire affects three guards but misses the basilisk and knight

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: For my bonus action, I would like to hide. 19. Lots of guards! And a basilisk! Y'all, we got a basilisk!
segments.summary: Thimble successfully hides and warns the party about enemies

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: This knight of House Seremai is going to look at you, Tyranny. I'm going to need a wisdom saving throw from you.
segments.summary: Knight of House Seremai targets Tyranny with an ability requiring a wisdom save

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: The knight looks up at you and you see once again, with the light of the Faerie Fire behind him, the sclera, the whites of his eyes go this brilliant luminous poison green, his pupils going into vertical slits as he looks at you and says, 'Freeze!' And you, on a three, feel yourself voluntarily, or autonomically, I should say. Your body, it's not happening as a physical restraint. He speaks to something in your spine that tells you to freeze in the way that a mouse does in the jaw of a snake when it knows that it is going to die.
segments.summary: Tyranny fails the save and is paralyzed by the knight's supernatural gaze

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: He's then going to yank back on the chain here, step to one side, pull the basilisk inward, and speak to the other soldiers and say, 'Find the fairy. Kill her!'
segments.summary: The knight commands the basilisk and orders soldiers to kill Thimble

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Would Kattigan have knowledge of what a basilisk is in this world? DC 15. No, it's a 13.
segments.summary: Kattigan attempts to recall knowledge about basilisks but only partially succeeds

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: On a 13, you've heard of a basilisk. They either eat people or poison or they can fly or they can turn people to stone or they themselves turn to stone if sunlight touches them. It's one of those.
segments.summary: Kattigan recalls confused knowledge about basilisk abilities

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: He'll just turn back to Wulferic and for my bonus action, I will, for the first time, use my one wondrous item in my inventory, which is Wulferic's Relic Reload. So the quiver on Wulferic's hip contains a single bolt. It looks like it should hold more, but
segments.summary: Kattigan uses Wulferic's Relic Reload item for the first time

segments.speaker: Robbie (Kattigan)
segments.content: there's just one and it's just glowing white. He's going to tuck it in his hip belt and then say to Wulferic: Watch over Wick. Then I'm going to use all of my I action to-- I'm going to go use my movement to do 30 feet, and then I guess I would have to use--
segments.summary: Kattigan stores an item, commands Wulferic to guard Wick, and begins movement

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Five, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30, gets you here.
segments.summary: DM tracks Kattigan's movement

segments.speaker: Robbie (Kattigan)
segments.content: Then I'll use my action to dash.
segments.summary: Kattigan uses his action to dash

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Yeah. Yes, you get to here, right behind Tyranny.
segments.summary: DM confirms Kattigan's position behind Tyranny

segments.speaker: Robbie (Kattigan)
segments.content: Great. That would be it, but can I ask my question? So I have a possible reaction that I can only use once a short or long rest for Wulferic, which is Primal Guardian. If I commanded him to stay with Wick, could I apply Primal Guardian to Wick if they were companions together? If I said your job is to guard and basically, a creature within five-- If it hits you, you'd get a plus two to your AC.
segments.summary: Kattigan asks about using Primal Guardian ability to protect Wick through Wulferic

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I will allow, in this instance, you to apply that to Wick. That sounds great to me. Yes, absolutely. So as a reaction, you're going to say, "Protect," and he'll add a plus two to Wick's armor class.
segments.summary: DM allows Kattigan to use Primal Guardian to protect Wick

segments.speaker: Robbie (Kattigan)
segments.content: So if you get tagged-- You could add plus two, but it'd have to be close. Because if it's within one or two, it could-- it could save you. Okay. All right.
segments.summary: Kattigan explains how the protection would work

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Whoa. Amazing. Amazing, thank you so much. I'll take it. That's a good boy. Uh-huh.
segments.summary: Wick thanks Kattigan for the protection

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I love it. Kattigan, you rush forward, the other soldiers here see you and they are going to rush forward as well. One-- two-- Yeah, you see this slammed tunnel fighting up here. You see these two-- So yeah, this guy surges forward here, the rest here, and you see the others hear a call from further in. You hear someone say, "Ready the cart!" and rush further in.
segments.summary: Enemy soldiers advance and someone calls to ready a cart deeper in

segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: What does that mean?
segments.summary: Thimble questions the meaning of the cart command

segments.speaker: Sam (Wick) and Whitney (Tyranny)
segments.content: Cart?
segments.summary: Wick and Tyranny echo confusion about the cart

segments.speaker: Robbie (Kattigan)
segments.content: Ready the what?!
segments.summary: Kattigan expresses confusion about the cart

segments.speaker: Travis (Teor)
segments.content: We came down stairs, right? There's got to be another exit in this place.
segments.summary: Teor deduces there must be another exit

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: These two are going to attack. Tyranny, frozen as you are, you see that one of these guys uses you like a rest on a pool table, putting the pole arm on your shoulder to stab past you. Literally using your frozen body as half cover.
segments.summary: Enemy soldiers attack, using frozen Tyranny as cover

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Am I paralyzed?
segments.summary: Tyranny asks about her condition

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)

segments.content: Eight.
segments.summary: Confirming eight healing

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Hey.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: But--

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: But.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: But what?

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: But, that's it. Yeah, that's it.
segments.summary: Kattigan has no more resources

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Well, at least he can roll away.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Yeah, he can do stuff. He can do stuff.

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Tuck and roll.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Ooh! Hello!
segments.summary: Wicander awakens

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Immediately after Kattigan goes, any bonus actions from you?
segments.summary: Checking for Kattigan's bonus actions

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: No.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Immediately after Kattigan goes, you are still prone, and you are hit for, eight points of damage.
segments.summary: Wicander immediately takes eight damage

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Stop. (laughter)
segments.summary: Laura reacts to immediate damage

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As this guy--
segments.summary: Guard attacks Wicander

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Thank you. (laughter)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: This guy thuds with a spear. He's trying to be like, 'If I die, I will kill a great lord.' And thuds a spear into your side. You take eight points of damage. You're not down again?
segments.summary: Guard desperately attacks Wicander with spear

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: I am.
segments.summary: Wicander confirms he's unconscious again

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You are? How much did you heal?
segments.summary: Confirming healing amount

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Like eight. (laughter)
segments.summary: Eight points healed

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Yes, exactly eight.
segments.summary: Exactly eight points healed

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Exactly eight, the whole thing.
segments.summary: All healing immediately negated

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: You're back! I've got you. (laughter)
segments.summary: Kattigan's ironic success

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Ah! (laughter)
